qas.question: Which confederation defeated the Han in 200 BC?
What type of campaign helped establish the Silk Road?
In what year was Nanyue annexed?
Which confederation conquered the territories north of the Han's border?
In what year did Emperor Wu of Han's reign end?

context: <a0_0>The Xiongnu<a0_0/>, a nomadic steppe confederation, defeated the Han in 200 BC and forced the Han to submit as a de facto inferior partner, but continued their raids on the Han borders. Emperor Wu of Han (r. 141–<a4_0>87 BC<a4_0/>) launched several <a1_0>military<a1_0/> campaigns against them. The ultimate Han victory in these wars eventually forced the Xiongnu to accept vassal status as Han tributaries. These campaigns expanded Han sovereignty into the Tarim Basin of Central Asia, divided the Xiongnu into two separate confederations, and helped establish the vast trade network known as the Silk Road, which reached as far as the Mediterranean world. The territories north of Han's borders were quickly overrun by the nomadic <a3_0>Xianbei<a3_0/> confederation. Emperor Wu also launched successful military expeditions in the south, annexing Nanyue in <a2_0>111 BC<a2_0/> and Dian in 109 BC, and in the Korean Peninsula where the Xuantu and Lelang Commanderies were established in 108 BC.
